title: Drawing, "Design for necklace", 1770–90
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on light green paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The chain around the neck consists of printed ovals containing a scroll of ribbon between two rows of disks, à jour connected by knots. Hanging from central one is a drop with a small knot above.  The hanging chains are composed of similar ovals and knots but the character of a ribbon is more emphasized.  They are fastened by a knot, with ends hanging down interlaced, and supporting three drops.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for necklace", 1770–90.
1770–90. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on light green paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-782.
